meanings.definition: To express sympathy or sorrow for someone's loss or suffering.
meanings.sent1: I condole with you on the passing of your pet.
meanings.sent2: It is important to condole with those who are going through a difficult time.
meanings.sent3: Let's condole with Tom for losing his favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed to condole with the grieving widow.
meanings.sent5: She always knew how to condole with others in times of need.

meanings.definition: To grieve or mourn with someone.
meanings.sent1: We will condole together over the loss of our beloved teacher.
meanings.sent2: Friends often come together to condole when a loved one passes away.
meanings.sent3: The puppy seemed to condole with its owner after the loss of their old dog.
meanings.sent4: The wind whispered through the trees, as if trying to condole with the grieving family.
meanings.sent5: In times of sorrow, it is comforting to have someone to condole with.

meanings.sent1: I will condole with the family by sending them a heartfelt card.
meanings.sent2: Neighbors gathered to condole with the family after the tragic accident.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to condole with its owner by purring softly.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden appeared to condole with each other in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: She wanted to condole with her friend but didn't know what to say.
